segments.text: I notice the structure of the kitchen; everything seems in its place, yet something is very wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water spills over the sink like a waterfall, creating an uncontrolled mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can the woman be so oblivious, with a flood at her feet and children in peril?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching for the cookie jar, his determination evident in every little stretch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel a sense of dread as I watch him wobble on that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is eagerly waiting, her palm open and ready; it’s heartbreaking to witness this folly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The openness of the window contrasts sharply with the chaos, a reminder of the calm outside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s something so innocent about their collaboration, yet it feels so wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I worry for their safety, yet I can't look away from the scene before me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What will it take for this idyllic moment to shatter?
segments.speaker: PAR
